channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: Microsoft Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Use Endpoint Privilege Management to transition users from administrator to standard user - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand the steps and phases for using Endpoint Privilege Management to transition users from administrators to standard users.

item.title: Using Remote Help on macOS to assist authenticated users. - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Remote Help to provide remote assistance to authenticated users and to troubleshoot for frontline workers (FLW).

item.title: Microsoft Intune documentation - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about Microsoft Intune's unified endpoint management and security solutions.

item.title: Microsoft Intune product and capabilities documentation
item.description: Learn more about how Microsoft Intune products and capabilities can help you secure, deploy, and manage users, apps, and endpoint devices.

item.title: App protection policies overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Microsoft Intune app protection policies help protect your company data and prevent data loss.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS app protection policy settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the iOS/iPadOS app protection policy (APP) settings for iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension for Windows.

item.title: Manage Apple volume-purchased apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to sync apps you bought in volume through Apple Business Manager with Microsoft Intune. Then manage and track these apps on iOS/iPadOS and macOS devices.

item.title: Create a policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to configure thousands of settings for Windows 10/11, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Android client devices, including Microsoft Office apps, Microsoft Edge, administrative templates (ADMX), and more. Add these settings in a device configuration profile to secure devices, and control different programs and features. Use Microsoft Copilot to get What If analysis, and learn more about each setting.

item.title: Use ADMX templates on Windows devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the settings catalog to configure administrative templates (ADMX) in Microsoft Intune on Windows 10/11 client devices. You can configure some Control Panel features, Start menu and task bar notifications, event log service, prevent IIS installation, and more.

item.title: Add Microsoft 365 Apps to Windows 10/11 devices using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can use Microsoft Intune to install Microsoft 365 apps on Windows 10/11 devices.

item.title: Assign apps to groups in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to assign an Intune app to groups of users or devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: App configuration policies for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use app configuration policies on an iOS/iPadOS or Android device in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Android app protection policy settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This topic describes the app protection policy settings for Android devices.

item.title: Add Win32 app supersedence - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Win32 app supersedence with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Endpoint management services and solutions at Microsoft
item.description: Microsoft Intune is a family of on-premises products and cloud services. It includes Intune, Configuration Manager, co-management, Endpoint Analytics, Windows Autopilot, and the admin center to manage cloud devices and on on-premises.

item.title: Troubleshoot Win32 apps in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the most common methods to troubleshoot Win32 app issues with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add a Windows line-of-business app to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add a Windows line-of-business (LOB) app using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manually add the Windows 10 Company Portal app - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how your workforce can manually add the Windows 10 Company Portal app to their PC from the Microsoft Store.

item.title: Windows app deployment by using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Windows 10/11 app deployment scenarios available with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: What is device management? - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about what device management means and how it can help organizations, including Microsoft 365 small & medium business, and enterprise. See a list of features and benefits, including mobile device management (MDM) and mobile application management (MAM), and learn about Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add web apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding web apps (client-server applications) to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use shell scripts on macOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create, assign, monitor, and troubleshoot shell scripts for macOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add app configuration policies for managed Android Enterprise devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use app configuration policies in Microsoft Intune to supply settings when users run a Managed Google Play app.

item.title: Join your cloud-native endpoints to Microsoft Entra
item.description: When moving to or using cloud-native endpoints, use Microsoft Entra joined endpoints. When your endpoints are joined to Microsoft Entra, you can use Windows Autopilot to provision or get devices ready for organization use. Learn more about the benefits to IT admins and end-users.

item.title: Add an unmanaged macOS PKG app to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about how to add an unmanaged macOS PKG app to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Connect to the Data Warehouse with Power BI - Microsoft Intune
item.description: You can download a file for use with Microsoft Power BI that allows you to load interactive, dynamically generated reports for your Microsoft Intune tenant.

item.title: Windows Delivery Optimization settings for Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Delivery Optimization settings for Windows devices that you can deploy using Intune.

item.title: Data protection for Windows MAM - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable protected MAM access to org data using Windows MAM.

item.title: Include and exclude app assignments in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can use Microsoft Intune to include and exclude app assignments.

item.title: Add iOS store apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding iOS store apps to Microsoft Intune. You can assign apps using this method if the apps are free of charge in the App Store.

item.title: Use the Intune Data Warehouse - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Intune Data Warehouse to build reports that provide insight into your enterprise mobile environment.

item.title: Add and assign an app - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this article, you'll use Microsoft Intune to add and assign an app.

item.title: Configure wired network settings for Windows devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create or add a wired network device configuration profile for Windows 10/11 devices. See the different settings, add certificates, choose an EAP type, and select an authentication method in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure Wi-Fi settings for iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create or add a WiFi device configuration profile for iOS/iPadOS devices. See the different settings, including adding certificates, choosing an EAP type, and selecting an authentication method in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Policies for Microsoft 365 apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand the policies available for Microsoft 365 apps.

item.title: Get started with macOS endpoints
item.description: Microsoft Intune guide to set up and configure macOS devices from setup to creating policies and enrolling devices. You secure your corporate and organization-owned endpoints that are enrolled in Intune, and then deploy at scale with Apple Business Manager or Apple School Manager.

item.title: Admin checklist for iOS/iPadOS software updates in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidance and advice for administrators that create and manage software updated for iOS/iPadOS devices using Microsoft Intune. See sample policy for different industry scenarios, including shared devices, kiosk, manufacturing, and information worker.

item.title: Assign a role to an Intune administrator - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to assign a built-in or custom role to a user in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage Microsoft 365 (Office) for iOS and Android with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune app protection and configuration policies with Microsoft 365 (Office) for iOS and Android to ensure collaboration experiences are always accessed with safeguards in place.

item.title: Configuration policies for Intune App SDK managed apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to configure policies for Intune App SDK managed apps.

item.title: Add Android store apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add Android store apps from the Google Play store to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Understanding Microsoft Intune management agent for macOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the Microsoft Intune management agent for macOS.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS bundle IDs for built-in apps in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See a list of the bundle IDs for the built-in iOS and iPadOS apps. Use these bundle IDs to explicitly allow apps in device configuration profiles and policies in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Mobile Application Management (MAM) and Android Enterprise personally-owned work profiles in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the available features when deciding to use Mobile Application Management (MAM) and/or Android Enterprise personally-owned work profiles for personal or BYOD Android devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure Google Chrome for Android devices using Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune configuration policies with Google Chrome for Android devices.

item.title: Use on-premises services with cloud-native endpoints
item.description: For cloud-native endpoints to access on-premises resources, such as file servers, printers, and web servers, use Windows integrated authentication (WIA) and Microsoft Entra Connect.

item.title: Get app bundle ID - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get the app bundle ID in Microsoft Intune for Android, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Windows apps. Use the bundle ID in your app policies, device configuration profiles, enrollment policies, and compliance policies in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Admin checklist for Android software updates in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidance and advice for administrators that create and manage software updated for Android devices using Microsoft Intune. See tasks and settings that can manage updates on corporate owned Android Enterprise devices.

item.title: Admin checklist for software updates on BYOD in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidance and advice for administrators that create and manage software updated for BYOD and personally owned devices using Microsoft Intune. See tasks and settings that can manage updates on personal devices on Android and iOS/iPadOS platforms.

item.title: Understand app protection policy delivery and timing - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the different deployment windows for app protection policies to understand when changes should appear on your end user devices.

item.title: Add Microsoft Defender for Endpoint to macOS devices using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding Microsoft Defender for Endpoint to macOS devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: What are cloud-native Windows endpoints
item.description: Learn more about cloud-native endpoints and what they are. See a list of benefits, and the effect on end users and IT administrators. Cloud-native endpoints help with remote workers and hybrid workers, and use Microsoft Intune to manage devices.

item.title: Configure 802.1x wired network settings for macOS and Windows devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create or add a wired network device configuration profile or policy using the IEEE 802.1X standard for macOS, Windows 10, and Windows 11 devices and computers. See the different settings, add certificates, choose an EAP type, and select an authentication method in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add built-in apps to mobile devices using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can use Intune to make it easier to install built-in apps mobile devices.

item.title: Configure a VPN or per-app VPN for Android Enterprise devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use an app configuration policy to add or create a VPN or per-app VPN profile for Android Enterprise devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add Microsoft Store apps to Intune (legacy) - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding Microsoft Store (legacy) apps to Intune.

item.title: Review app protection policy logs - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This topic describes how to configure Intune app protection policy (APP) logs.

item.title: Apple configuration list for Intune settings catalog - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Microsoft Intune settings catalog to add, configure, or restrict features on Apple devices. This article lists and describes the settings you can configure.

item.title: Get started with frontline worker (FLW) device management
item.description: Learn how to manage frontline worker devices using Android, iOS/iPadOS, and Windows devices in Microsoft Intune. Get guidance on device use and Intune features built for FLW, like Remote Help. Also, learn about Microsoft Entra shared device mode (SDM) for FLW.

item.title: How to monitor app protection policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes how to monitor app protection policies in Intune.

item.title: Create quiet time policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to create quiet time policies for iOS/iPadOS and Android apps.

item.title: Get data from the Data Warehouse API with a REST client - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This topic describes how to retrieve data from the Microsoft Intune Data Warehouse using a RESTful API.

item.title: Add custom settings to iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Export iOS and iPadOS settings from Apple Configurator or Apple Profile Manager tools, and then import these settings into Microsoft Intune. These settings can create, use, and control custom settings and features on iOS/iPadOS devices. This custom profile can then be assigned or distributed to iOS/iPadOS devices in your organization to create a baseline or standard.

item.title: Configure Wi-Fi settings for Android DA devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create or add a WiFi device configuration profile for Android device administrator. See the different settings, including adding certificates, choosing an EAP type, and selecting an authentication method in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Intune Data Warehouse Collections - Microsoft Intune
item.description: The Intune Data Warehouse collections provide details related to the Data Warehouse API.

item.title: Create macOS system and kernel extensions with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about system extensions and kernel extensions for macOS devices. In Microsoft Intune, add or create a device configuration policy that configures kernel extensions. In the extension, you can allow user override, add a team identifier, and add a bundle and team identifier.

item.title: Step 4. Create app configuration policies for Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 4. Create app configuration policy for Microsoft Edge for Business.

item.title: Data Warehouse data model - Microsoft Intune
item.description: The Microsoft Intune Data Warehouse samples data daily to provide a historical view of your continually changing mobile environment.

item.title: Intune Data Warehouse API endpoint - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This reference topic describes the Microsoft Intune Data Warehouse API URL structure. Filter examples are provided.

item.title: Create and assign an app protection policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this article, you use Microsoft Intune to create and assign and app protection policy.

item.title: Intune Data Warehouse API - Microsoft Intune
item.description: You can use the Intune Data Warehouse API to build reports that provide insight into your enterprise mobile environment.

item.title: Apps for GCC High and DoD environments - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about apps involving GCC High and DoD environments using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure Microsoft Edge for Windows with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune configuration policies with Edge for Windows to ensure corporate websites are always accessed with safeguards in place.

item.title: App protection policies for extensions - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This topic describes the app protection policy (APP) for extensions.

item.title: Step 2. Create app protection policies for Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 2. Create app protection policies for Microsoft Edge for Business.

item.title: Step 1. Create Microsoft Entra Conditional Access with Microsoft Edge for Business - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 1. Create Microsoft Entra Conditional Access with Microsoft Edge for Business.

item.title: Get started with Windows frontline worker devices
item.description: Learn how to manage frontline worker devices using Windows devices in Microsoft Intune. Select the best enrollment option, configure the home screen, and more.

item.title: Install Microsoft 365 apps to macOS devices using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can use Microsoft Intune to install Microsoft 365 apps on macOS devices.

item.title: Get started with Android frontline worker devices
item.description: Learn how to manage frontline worker devices using Android devices in Microsoft Intune. Select the best enrollment option, configure the home screen, and more.

item.title: Enable Win32 apps on S mode devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enable Win32 apps on S mode devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Allow or block apps for Samsung Knox Standard devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create a custom profile to allow and block apps for Samsung Knox Standard Android device administrator devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Guided update supersedence for Enterprise App Management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to update an Enterprise App Catalog app using supersedence with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Reference for Application entities - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Reference topic for the Application category of entity collections in the Intune Data Warehouse API.

item.title: Step 5. Understand Microsoft Edge for Business end user experience for Windows - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 5. Understand Microsoft Edge for Business end user experience Windows.

item.title: Manage volume-purchased apps and books with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about how you can use Microsoft Intune to manage and monitor your use of volume-purchased apps and books from stores."

item.title: Intune settings for the iOS/iPadOS Classroom app - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the Intune settings you can use to control settings for the Classroom app on iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Reference for Policy entities - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Reference topic for the Policy category of entity collections in the Intune Data Warehouse API.

item.title: Step 3. Integrate Mobile Threat Defense for App Protection Policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 3. Integrate Microsoft Entra Conditional Access with Microsoft Edge for Business.

item.title: Mobile App Management (MAM) - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Reference topic for the Mobile App Management category of entity collections in the Intune Data Warehouse API.

item.title: Step 6. Troubleshoot Microsoft Edge for Business data security - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Step 6. Troubleshoot Microsoft Edge for Business corporate data security in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Move your Intune Data Warehouse account data - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand how to back up your Intune Data Warehouse data when moving your account.

item.title: Validate your app protection policy setup - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to test that your app protection policy is set up and working correctly in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: App protection policy settings for Windows - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the app protection policy (APP) settings for MAM on Windows.

item.title: Monitor app information and assignments - Microsoft Intune
item.description: After you've assigned an app to users or devices, use this information to help you monitor the app's status.

item.title: Prepare a Win32 app to be uploaded to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to prepare a Win32 app to be uploaded to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Tutorial - Configure Slack to use Intune for EMM and app configuration - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this tutorial you will configure Slack to use Intune for EMM and app configuration.

item.title: Manage volume-purchased iOS/iPadOS eBooks - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to sync books you purchased in volume from the iOS store with Intune. You can then manage and track usage.

item.title: Add custom settings to Linux devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add Bash scripts to create a custom Linux profile in Microsoft Intune. Use the script to create, use, and control custom settings and features on Linux devices. This custom profile can then be assigned or distributed to Linux devices in your organization to create a baseline or standard.
